title: Andrew Lincoln 'very excited' by the new Love Actually sequel
text:
Andrew Lincoln 'very excited' by the new Love Actually sequel The actor can't wait to reprise his role as unlucky-in-love Mark in the Comic Relief special Share Andrew Lincoln is excited about his return to Love Actually (Photo: Universal Studios) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Andrew Lincoln is ‘very excited’ by the prospect of the new Love Actually film - and can’t wait to get filming the Comic Relief special. 
The actor is reprising his role as Mark in the much-anticipated ‘sequel’ to the 2003 film, and he’s delighted that director Richard Curtis has reunited the cast for the charity special. 
“It’s fun and going to be really great to see everyone again,” he told Entertainment Weekly . “It’s very exciting. It’s a very cool thing. 
“Richard got in touch about a month ago and mentioned he had something in mind. I’m shooting some time in March.” Andrew as Mark, who's hopelessly in love with Keira Knightley's Juliet (Photo: Universal Studios) Andrew Lincoln and Keira Knightley in the famous scene from the film (Photo: Rex Features) 
Other stars of the original film involved in the new project include Keira Knightley, Colin Firth, Rowan Atkinson, Liam Neeson, Bill Nighy and Thomas Brodie-Sangster. 
Comic Relief Actually will be a ten minute short for Red Nose Day, and will air on BBC One as part of their Comic Relief coverage on 24 March. 
The short film will revisit the characters from the much-loved British movie and Richard had a great time working on the script. 
"Over the years I've enjoyed doing Red Nose Day specials of TV things I've worked on - Blackadder, The Vicar of Dibley and Mr Bean. 
"It seemed like a fun idea this year to do a special sketch based one of my films, since Red Nose Day is now in both the UK and America. Rowan Atkinson filming with director Richard Curtis in Sainsburys (Photo: PA) Alan Rickman and Emma Thompson in Love Actually 
"I would never have dreamt of writing a sequel to' Love Actually', but I thought it might be fun to do 10 minutes to see what everyone is now up to. Who has aged best? - I guess that's the big question... or is it so obviously Liam?" 
Sadly Emma Thompson is one of the stars who won’t be returning - and it’s because she can’t face filming without her on-screen partner, Alan Rickman, who died last year. 
"Richard wrote me out and said, 'Darling we can't write anything for you because of Alan', and I said, 'no of course, it would be sad, too sad,’” Emma told PA. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
